inspirationalQuotes.text: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.
inspirationalQuotes.author: William Osler

inspirationalQuotes.text: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.
inspirationalQuotes.author: Hippocrates

inspirationalQuotes.text: The art of medicine consists of amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
inspirationalQuotes.author: Voltaire

paretoBanner.title: Master 80% of the Content
paretoBanner.description: Focus on the 20% of topics that appear most frequently in exams. Start with our high-yield notes to streamline your study.

questionOfTheDay.question: A 55-year-old man presents with sudden-onset chest pain. An ECG shows ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF. Which coronary artery is most likely occluded?

subjects.name: Anatomy
subjects.description: Anatomy is the branch of biology concerned with the study of the structure of organisms and their parts. It is a cornerstone of medical education.

histology.title: Histology: A Text and Atlas With Correlated Cell and Molecular Biology
histology.author: 6th Edition

atlases.title: Anatomy 360 - The Ultimate Visual Guide to the Human Body

subjects.name: Physiology
subjects.description: Physiology is the scientific study of functions and mechanisms in a living system. It focuses on how organisms, organ systems, individual organs, cells, and biomolecules carry out the chemical and physical functions in a living system.

subjects.name: Biochemistry
subjects.description: Biochemistry is the study of chemical processes within and relating to living organisms. It's a laboratory based science that brings together biology and chemistry.

subjects.name: Pathology
subjects.description: Pathology is the medical specialty concerned with the cause, origin, and nature of disease. It involves the examination of tissues, organs, bodily fluids, and autopsies in order to study and diagnose disease.

subjects.name: Pharmacology
subjects.description: Pharmacology is the branch of medicine and biology concerned with the study of drug action, where a drug can be broadly defined as any man-made, natural, or endogenous molecule which exerts a biochemical or physiological effect on the cell, tissue, organ, or organism.

subjects.name: Microbiology
subjects.description: Microbiology is the scientific study of microorganisms, those being unicellular (single cell), multicellular (cell colony), or acellular (lacking cells). Microbiology encompasses numerous sub-disciplines including virology, mycology, parasitology, and bacteriology.

subjects.name: Forensic Medicine
subjects.description: Forensic medicine is a branch of medicine that applies medical knowledge to legal questions. It is a key component in the investigation of crimes and is used to determine causes of death and injury.

subjects.name: Community Medicine
subjects.description: Community medicine is a branch of medicine that is concerned with the health of the members of a community, municipality, or region. It focuses on the prevention of disease and the promotion of health in a population.

subjects.name: ENT
subjects.description: Otorhinolaryngology (ENT) is a surgical subspecialty within medicine that deals with the surgical and medical management of conditions of the head and neck.

subjects.name: Ophthalmology
subjects.description: Ophthalmology is a branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis and treatment of eye disorders. Ophthalmologists are specialists in eye and vision care.

subjects.name: General Medicine
subjects.description: General medicine is the medical specialty dealing with the prevention, diagnosis, and non-surgical treatment of adult diseases.

subjects.name: General Surgery
subjects.description: General surgery is a surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents including the esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver, pancreas, gallbladder, appendix and bile ducts, and often the thyroid gland.

subjects.name: OBG
subjects.description: Obstetrics and gynaecology (or obstetrics and gynecology; often abbreviated to OB/GYN, O&G or Obs & Gynae) are the two surgical-medical specialties dealing with the female reproductive organs in their pregnant and non-pregnant state, respectively.

subjects.name: Pediatrics
subjects.description: Pediatrics is the branch of medicine that involves the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents.

subjects.name: Orthopedics
subjects.description: Orthopedic surgery or orthopedics is the branch of surgery concerned with conditions involving the musculoskeletal system. Orthopedic surgeons use both surgical and nonsurgical means to treat musculoskeletal trauma, spine diseases, sports injuries, degenerative diseases, infections, tumors, and congenital disorders.

subjects.name: Radiology
subjects.description: Radiology is the medical discipline that uses medical imaging to diagnose and treat diseases within the bodies of animals and humans.

subjects.name: Anesthesiology
subjects.description: Anesthesiology, anaesthesiology, or anaesthesia is the medical specialty concerned with the total perioperative care of patients before, during and after surgery. It encompasses anesthesia, intensive care medicine, critical emergency medicine, and pain medicine.

subjects.name: Psychiatry
subjects.description: Psychiatry is the medical specialty devoted to the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of mental disorders. These include various maladaptations related to mood, behaviour, cognition, and perceptions.

subjects.name: Dermatology
subjects.description: Dermatology is the branch of medicine dealing with the skin. It is a specialty with both medical and surgical aspects. A dermatologist is a specialist medical doctor who manages diseases related to skin, hair, nails, and some cosmetic problems.
